structure.unit: Registration Of Certain Professions And Occupations

law.catch_line: Sterilization; Physician To Have Written Consent Before Performing Surgical Or Medical Procedure
law.text: No physician shall perform, other than in an emergency, an operation which is intended to result in the sterilization of an individual unless he has a knowledgeable consent in writing from such individual. A physician who performs said operation without such consent shall be punished by a fine of not more than ten thousand dollars.
